Just a note for everyone, I see alot of people asking will it run withthis system, will it run this software etc... this is a DEVELOPER BUILD it is NOT stable, it is NOT a beta release. don't switch your main OS for this. 

Best thing to do is get yourself a crappy tablet, or notebook and run it on that. play, with it, see how many times you can make it crash and just generally don't care. 

If you want something to replace your main os, wait for the Beta or RC.

@chrisean88 DO NOT INSTALL THIS, this is a Developers Preview. it is NOT stable. Only install in some kind of Virtual Machine, there are some tutorials already how to do that.

This is actually pretty good for desktop PC use, if you disable the stupid Metro tile system to get the real Start Menu back, among other things.  It becomes a faster version of Windows 7 in most respects, with some fairly decent new features.

One thing I will say is, watch out for compatibility with existing hardware.  I was using an old laptop with a not-too-well supported ATI X600 graphics card and could not make any of the old driver versions run.  The only solution was to upgrade my previous version of Windows 7 after doing a backup instead of using a clean install on another harddrive.  It was either that orspend hours trying various old driver versions and hacks to get it working.

Link has been pulled down at
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/apps/br229516

This is now the best place to get Dev Preview.

Consumer Preview is out, but disables support for many slower devices, including Pentium M with 400Mhz FSB.

If you want to make a Windows To Go USB system, this is the torrent for you!  Consumer Preview on USB will work on newer systems but leave you SOL when you need it on corporate Dell D600s or the like.
